task_summary: Detect the T-block and the goal outline, approach and align to the block, then execute two pushes to drive it into the target footprint and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm with a circular tool must push a T-shaped block to a fixed target outline on a planar tabletop. The robot first perceives the block and the goal, approaches to a safe pre-contact height, aligns its tool to the block’s pushing face, and then performs a primary long push followed by a shorter corrective push to seat the block inside the target shape. After confirming alignment near the goal, the arm retreats clear of the workspace. Control/observation nominally occur at 10 Hz.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T-block and the goal outline
Robot kinematics calibrated to table frame
End-effector tip is circular and safe for contact pushing
stepwise_plan: Set control rate hint on blackboard (10 Hz).
Execute short corrective push to adjust orientation.
Align with goal_T footprint for final placement.
success_criteria: T-block center and orientation lie within goal_T tolerance
No loss of contact stability during pushes
failure_and_recovery: Perception fails: re-detect targets and re-approach
Push overshoots or under-rotates: perform additional corrective push with adjusted yaw/direction
Tool slips off block: re-align using ApproachAndAlign then retry push
task_long_description.termination: Tree ends after retreat once the block is aligned within the goal area.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Move above the block at safe height.
Align tool to the block face.
Corrective diagonal push for pose adjustment.
Seat the block within the goal footprint.

failure_modes: Block rotates unexpectedly during long push
recovery_strategy: Re-run DetectObject for both targets and re-approach
Adjust yaw or direction and execute an extra corrective Push
If slip detected, re-align with ApproachAndAlign before pushing again
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a blue goal outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target—treated as a color mismatch without affecting semantics.
End-effector appears metallic; treated as circular as per instruction.
10 Hz mentioned is encoded as a blackboard hint rather than strict timing control due to available ports.

expected_success_criteria: Block’s centroid and orientation inside goal_T tolerance after final alignment
Robot retreats without disturbing the block
